description: Cyril Ramaphosa was reelected as South Africa’s president, hours after his African National Congress agreed a power-sharing deal with business-friendly opposition parties.
title: Ramaphosa Reelected as South African President

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: No-Shows at Ukraine Summit Underscore Ambivalence Over War

description: Narendra Modi seized a window to end his diplomatic purgatory.
title: Murder Plot Furor Fades as Modi Emerges From Spurned Status

description: Rishi Sunak said he would stay on as a member of Parliament for five years, the typical full-length term of a UK government, even if his Conservative Party is ousted from power in next month’s general election.
title: Sunak Vows to Stay as MP for 5 Years If Tories Lose UK Election

description: Taiwan is deepening economic integration with other democracies and working with partners including the US to deter China’s President Xi Jinping from ordering an invasion of the island, Taipei’s envoy to Washington said.
title: Taiwan Envoy Says Island Deepening Ties With US to Deter China

description: A person died and several were injured on Friday in Mexico following a car crash involving a vehicle carrying members of President-Elect Claudia Sheinbaum’s team, her office confirmed in a statement.
title: Sheinbaum Team’s Car in Mexico Crashes, Leaving One Dead

description: One of Canada’s biggest banks says housing affordability is poised to gradually get better — but not enough to bring it close to pre-pandemic levels.
title: Home Affordability to Improve in Canada as Rates Fall and Incomes Rise, BMO Says

description: The US Justice Department won’t prosecute Attorney General Merrick Garland over a referral by House Republicans to hold him in contempt of Congress.
title: DOJ Won’t Prosecute Garland for Contempt of Congress

description: French President Emmanuel Macron lashed out at the opposition on the left and right, calling both sides “incoherent” as he left the Group of Seven summit.
title: Macron Accuses French Left and Right of ‘Incoherent’ Pitches

description: Nearly two-thirds of likely California voters say it’s not a good time to take on more debt for state programs and infrastructure projects as legislators consider placing several bond measures on the November ballot, according to a poll conducted by the Public Policy Institute of California.
title: California Voters Sour on New Bonding Measures, Poll Shows

description: Few things capture the mood among world leaders better than a Group of Seven family photo. The simmering rage at perceived slights, the relegation of unpopular leaders to the back, smiles that seem a tad forced given all the problems left back home.
title: G-7 Leaders Gather for Historic Family Photo With Pope Francis

description: Under the banner “Invest in Dignity,” the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia let the world know it’s ready to do business in Latin America, hosting a three-day summit on Brazil’s most famous beach.
title: Saudis Woo Billionaires in Rio as Wealth Fund Taps Latin America

description: Niger closed an oil pipeline used to export crude through a port in neighboring Benin, ratcheting up tensions between the two countries amid an ongoing border impasse.
title: Niger Stops Chinese Oil Exports Through Benin Over Border Feud

description: The State Department imposed sanctions on an Israeli extremist group accused of blocking and destroying aid to Palestinians in the Gaza Strip, the latest in a broader US push to ease what the United Nations says is a looming famine in the enclave.
title: US Sanctions Israeli Extremist Group for Destroying Gaza Aid

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s party is increasingly pressing the German leader to show more assertive leadership after its European election rout, starting with coalition wrangling over the 2025 federal budget.
title: Scholz Pressed to Sharpen His Leadership After EU Election Rout

description: Lawmakers in South Africa’s KwaZulu-Natal province elected an Inkatha Freedom Party official as premier, dealing a blow to the organization led by former President Jacob Zuma that won the most votes in the region.
title: Zuma Outmaneuvered in South African Province That Backed Him

description: Colombia is on track for its widest fiscal deficit since the Covid-19 pandemic as falling tax revenues leave a hole in the nation’s finances.
title: Colombia Targets Widest Fiscal Deficit Since 2020 Pandemic

description: A long-awaited import tax on purchases up to $50 will offer short-term relief to Brazil’s battered retailers as they stumble over longer-term hurdles.
title: Crop-Top Tax Offers a Bit of Relief to Struggling Brazil Retailers

description: Alphabet Inc. will have to defend itself at trial against all of the US Justice Department’s claims of a Google monopoly in online advertising technology after a federal judge rejected the tech giant’s request to decide the case ahead of time.
title: Google Ad Tech Antitrust Suit Will Go to Trial, Judge Rules

description: Keir Starmer’s poll-leading Labour Party received almost double the amount of political donations than Rishi Sunak’s governing Conservatives in the first official week of UK election campaigning.
title: Labour Donations Almost Double the Tories in First Pre-Vote Data

description: NATO defense ministers gave political backing to establishing a multinational battle group in Finland, which is responsible for guarding the military alliance’s longest border with Russia.
title: Finland Set to Boost NATO Stance With Multinational Battle Group

description: The election of the next South African president by lawmakers is expected to take place later on Friday, after voting to appoint the speaker and deputy speaker got delayed.
title: Voting Procedure Slows Election of South African President

description: The Swiss government confirmed that China won’t send a diplomat to a two-day summit on Ukraine, while India and Saudia Arabia will send senior officials to the June 15-16 meeting.
title: India, Saudi Arabia to Send Senior Envoys to Ukraine Summit

description: Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers blasted policy ideas floated by former President Donald Trump as immensely damaging to both the US and the global economy.
title: Summers Says Trump Tax Ideas Mean ‘Mother of All Stagflations’

description: South African lawmakers elected Thoko Didiza, a member of the African National Congress and former agriculture minister, as the speaker of the National Assembly.
title: South African Lawmakers Pick ANC’s Didiza as Parliament Speaker

description: The next generation of nuclear reactors will need to be financed by taxpayers because private investors aren’t willing to bear the risks associated with building new plants.
title: Building Nuclear Power Is a Bridge Too Far for World’s Private Investors

description: European Central Bank officials see no cause for alarm in the market turbulence that has engulfed France in the past few days, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: ECB Officials See No Cause for Alarm Over France’s Market Turmoil

description: A divided US Supreme Court dealt a fresh blow to firearm-regulation efforts by throwing out the federal ban on bump stocks, the attachments that let a semiautomatic rifle fire at speeds rivaling a machine gun.
title: Bump Stock Ban Tossed Out by Supreme Court in Gun-Rights Win

description: President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum’s sweep of Mexico’s election is breathing new life into outgoing President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador’s bid to exert more political control over the country’s energy sector.
title: Sheinbaum Win Gives AMLO One More Shot to Boost State Utilities

description: France’s Republicans edged closer to a breakup as the party’s bitter infighting played out in a Paris court, with its leader Eric Ciotti challenging a motion to expel him from the group after he struck a pact with Marine Le Pen’s far-right National Rally for the upcoming legislative election.
title: French Republican Party Faces Implosion as Boss Fights Ouster

description: Britain’s opposition Labour Party has ruled out a wide range of tax increases if it wins the election on July 4, but there’s leeway within that promise to increase levies in a few places.
title: Starmer Can Raise Taxes on Banks, Pensions Without a Big U-Turn

description: Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallas pushed back against criticism that her administration has disregarded a request for additional military spending needed to deter a potential Russian invasion.
title: Spending Dispute Puts EU Top Job Hopeful Kallas on Defensive

description: South Africa’s African National Congress and the Democratic Alliance committed to “rapid, inclusive and sustainable” economic growth in an agreement on forming a so-called government of national unity.
title: South Africa Unity Government Parties Back Rapid Economic Growth

description: South African stocks rallied and the rand gained, defying the global selloff in risk assets, as investors cheered an agreement between rival political parties to back the reelection of Cyril Ramaphosa as president.
title: Markets Cheer South Africa’s Move to Broad Government Alliance

description: A coalition of France’s left-wing parties presented a manifesto to pick apart most of President Emmanuel Macron’s seven years of economic reforms and set the country on a collision course with the European Union over fiscal policy.
title: French Left Unveils Plan to Undo Macron Reforms and Defy EU

description: Pope Francis landed in a white helicopter on Friday at the annual Group of Seven summit — the first ever pontiff to attend such an event.
title: Pope Lands at G-7 as Abortion Reference Dropped From Communique

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin called on Ukraine to withdraw its troops from four eastern regions, currently partially occupied by Russia, in order to start peace talks.
title: Putin Demands Ukraine Abandon Four Regions for Peace Talks

description: President Joe Biden and challenger Donald Trump face the same problem in their first debate: How to sway voters in a tight race where most Americans say they’ve already made up their minds.
title: Trump, Biden Prep for Debate Where Any Misstep Threatens Hopes

description: Brexit architect Nigel Farage’s populist Reform UK party rose to a record in Bloomberg’s poll of polls, signaling more woe for Prime Minster Rishi Sunak’s governing Conservatives with less than three weeks to go until the general election.
title: Farage’s Reform Party Rises to Record, Poll of Polls Shows

description: Crypto billionaires and their allies have amassed a $160 million war chest to protect their fortunes by bolstering US candidates who favor light-touch regulation of the embattled industry.
title: Crypto Titans’ $160 Million War Chest Threatens Senate Democrats

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: China Is Facing Trade Disputes on Every Continent

description: Former European Central Bank chief Mario Draghi said Sweden is an example for the European Union to emulate in its push for more productivity while retaining a robust safety net for the poor.
title: Draghi Showcases Sweden in Push for a More Productive EU

description: Investors inflicted a swift and sharp rebuke on French President Emmanuel Macron this week as his calling of a snap parliamentary election ignited warnings of a further deterioration in the nation’s finances and even fears of a fresh euro crisis.
title: Macron Election Call Sends French Markets to Worst Week in Years

description: Finnish authorities suspect a total of four Russian military aircraft were involved in the airspace violation on Monday instead of just one.
title: Finland Says More Russian Jets Involved in Airspace Breach

description: South African political parties that support a broad alliance to form the next government agreed to back candidates for president and the two highest positions in parliament, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: South African Unity Government Partners Agree Deal on Key Posts

description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis reshuffled his cabinet Friday following a weaker-than-expected result in European Parliament elections on Sunday.
title: Greek Premier Reshuffles His Cabinet After European Vote Outcome

description: Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said the time has come to place restrictions on cruise ships visiting Greece’s most popular islands, the government’s first move to cope with the effects of “over-tourism” in the post-pandemic period.
title: Greece’s Prime Minister Is Ready to Cap the Number of Cruise Ships at Country’s Most Popular Islands

description: From historians to CEOs, the answer’s the same: Only on our terms.
title: Why Ukraine Isn’t Ready for Peace Talks

description: Stellantis NV will shift production of some models made by China’s Leapmotor to Europe if tariffs on electric-vehicle imports announced this week go into effect.
title: Stellantis May Move Some Chinese EV Output to Europe on Tariffs

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban promised retaliation after a stinging European Union ruling on asylum policy, potentially clouding the country’s upcoming EU presidency.
title: Orban Vows to Avenge EU Ruling, Clouding Hungary’s Presidency

description: APULIA, ITALY - JUNE 12: A view of brochure with the logo of the G7 as the G7 Summit will be held in the exclusive resort "Borgo Egnazia" in Apulia, Italy on June 12, 2024. Leaders of the Group of Seven (G7) and invited leaders will confront the world's most relevant issues as the war in Ukraine and the Middle East, Artificial Intelligence, migration, economy and development. (Photo by Valeria Ferraro/Anadolu via Getty Images) Photographer: Anadolu/Anadolu
title: Modi, Pope Due at G-7 Summit as Talks Focus on Global South

description: European populists tend to provoke unjustified fear in financial markets, and France is likely to play to that script, according to Andromeda Capital Management co-founder Alberto Gallo.
title: Markets Needn’t Fear Europe’s Populists, Andromeda’s Gallo Says

description: Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire warned that a new left-wing coalition coming to power in France would lead to the country’s exit from the European Union.
title: French Finance Chief Warns Left Victory Means EU Exit

description: Group of Seven leaders meeting in Italy this week will pledge to tighten enforcement of their price cap on Russian oil, choke the Kremlin’s future energy projects and reduce Moscow’s revenues from metals, according to a statement seen by Bloomberg.
title: G-7 Pledges to Step Up Action on Russia Fleet, Energy, Metals

description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva stopped off in Switzerland on Thursday. He won’t be returning for a summit on Ukraine 48 hours later.
title: Ukraine Struggles to Court Global South Ahead of Swiss Summit

description: Norway’s planned clampdown on the nation’s wealthiest citizens is provoking a backlash from entrepreneurs who warn the measure will just worsen the economy’s heavy dependence on oil and gas.
title: Norway’s Tax-the-Rich Drive Provokes Widening Business Backlash

description: Britain’s two main parties have promised to make housing a priority after the country’s general election on July 4, boding well for homebuilders.
title: Homebuilders Eye Election Boost From Long-Awaited UK Reforms

description: The German government is working to prevent the European Union’s new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles from coming into force — or at least soften them should a full halt not be possible, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Germany Trying to Prevent or Soften EU Tariffs on Chinese EVs

description: In Portugal’s second-largest city, officials are banning new short-term units in busy areas while allowing them as a basis for urban regeneration in neglected quarters.
title: The Mayor Who Sees Airbnb as an Agent for Good

description: North Korea has sent containers to Russia that could hold nearly 5 million artillery shells and Russian President Vladimir Putin will likely seek even more when he soon visits Pyongyang, South Korea’s defense minister said.
title: Kim Sent Russia Millions of Artillery Shells, South Korea Says

description: Warnings of an industry exodus in Britain are overblown, but it’s still appropriate to ask if the juice is worth the squeeze.
title: Labour Party Is Right to Make Private Equity Pay Fair Tax

description: Rishi Sunak is warning that ambitious climate-change policies in the UK will hit taxpayers with higher bills, an election gambit that may backfire among some of his core supporters.
title: Sunak Risks Losing Solar-Loving Tories With Net Zero Hostility

description: The leader of Canada’s third-largest national party said some of the country’s lawmakers were “traitors” who should be banned from Parliament and face prosecution after he read a classified report on foreign interference in the democracy.
title: Canada Foreign Meddling Case Sparks Call of ‘Traitor’ Lawmakers

description: The US Justice Department said it returned an additional $156 million in misappropriated 1MDB funds to Malaysia, a month after the Southeast Asian nation sought extra compensation from US authorities.
title: US Returns $156 Million Misappropriated 1MDB Funds to Malaysia

description: President Joe Biden is planning an executive action as soon as next week that would protect certain undocumented immigrants from deportation, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Biden Readies Protections for Some Undocumented Migrants

description: Vietnam’s new President To Lam is looking to gradually expand security and defense ties with the US, he said during a Thursday meeting with US Ambassador Marc Knapper in Hanoi.
title: Vietnam Seeks to Gradually Expand Security, Defense Ties with US

description: China is likely to adopt limited and targeted retaliation against the European Union after the bloc unveiled tariff increases on Chinese electric cars, with Beijing wary that a more robust response could backfire.
title: Xi Has Few Options to Punish Europe Without Sparking Trade War

description: Indonesia’s President-elect Prabowo Subianto plans to fund his spending promises by steadily increasing the debt ratio to its highest in two decades.
title: Prabowo Plans to Raise Indonesia’s Debt-to-GDP Ratio Toward 50%
